poem:
### In the Age of Spectacle

Clad in purpose, they leap—
Figures of policy
Dissolved in the splash
Of the transient moment.

The water whispers
Of lost gravitas, 
While platforms rise,
Teeter, and fall.

Political acrobats,
Their shadows stretch thin
Against the silent wall,
Longing for the dignity of depth.
